<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 1"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Very Sneaky](/Feats.aspx?ID=46) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Goblin" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=81" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 49 <sup>4.0</sup></row>

</column>

---

Taller folk rarely pay attention to the shadows at their feet, and you take full advantage of this. You can move 5 feet farther when you take the [Sneak](/Actions.aspx?ID=63) action, up to your Speed. In addition, as long as you continue to use Sneak actions and succeed at your [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=15) check, you don't become [observed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=27) if you don't have cover or greater cover and aren't [concealed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=4) at the end of the Sneak action, as long as you have cover or greater cover or are concealed at the end of your turn.

<title level="2">Very Sneaky leads to...</title>
[Very, Very Sneaky](/Feats.aspx?ID=51)
